messages.title: A record of action in Oxford
messages.content: Nicola was in Oxford for the awful floods of 2007 and has campaigned ever since for flood defences to put an end to the exhausting stress of unpredictable flooding. Already the Osney Island defences and the £1m scheme at Munday's Bridge reduce flood risk. Now Nicola is fighting to ensure the £127m Oxford Flood Channel is delivered.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: After the horrific Oxford Sex Gang case, Nicola set up the 'Childhood Lost Campaign' which has changed the law so police can intervene earlier to protect children from sex abuse and fight for the new Ministry of Justice 'Victim’s Law' to protect witnesses in court.

Since 2010, Nicola’s jobs fairs have offered thousands of locals jobs and Abingdon & Witney College has had a £19m revamp. Now youth unemployment is down 63% and 2,240 new apprentices have started and the £14bn City & Growth Deals mean 24,000 new jobs.

Nicola fought for local children's services, successfully saving North Oxfordshire's Children Centre from closure, ensuring £46.4m is spent on new school places and over £6m on the Pupil Premium, to boost the life chances of disadvantaged children.

housing.content: Nicola has campaigned ever since for flood defences to put an end to the exhausting stress of unpredictable flooding.

politicalExperience.achievements: Nicola knows how tough teaching turned lives around.

endorsements.endorsement: Back Nicola's campaign for victims of child sexual exploitation.

images.caption: Nicola with supporters and local workers

leaflet.additionalNotes: Over 100,000, including NSPCC, Barnardo’s and local police, back Nicola’s campaign for victims of child sexual exploitation.
